articles.author: James Crisp, Ben Riley-Smith
articles.title: Trump links steel tariff to new Nafta deal
articles.description: Donald Trump has indicated he could abandon his steel tariff if other countries agreed to trade changes as his allies cleared the way for a possible change of mind.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Trump talks tariffs plan, exemptions at Cabinet meeting
articles.description: President Trump said an exemption from his proposed steel and aluminum tariff plan for countries like Canada and Mexico could be considered if a deal on NAFTA is reached.

articles.author: Bob Bryan
articles.title: Trump wants to slap massive tariffs on imported cars and trucks -- here's who would lose the most
articles.description: President Donald Trump is considering slapping tariffs on imported cars and trucks. Some countries would stand to lose a lot from a tariff on vehicles. More »

articles.author: David Krayden
articles.title: Canadian NAFTA Advisor Advocates Trade War If Trump Resorts To Tariffs
articles.description: ‘We have to protect our interests, there’s no doubt about that.’

articles.author: Linette Lopez
articles.title: There's a fatal flaw at the heart of Trump's auto tariff strategy
articles.description: A new Commerce Department investigation into foreign car imports is supposed to set up a win-lose scenario for the US in NAFTA negotiations. The problem is that's not how trade deals work. More »

articles.author: Linette Lopez
articles.title: There’s a fatal flaw at the heart of Trump's auto tariff strategy
articles.description: A new Commerce Department investigation into foreign car imports is supposed to set up a win-lose scenario for the US in NAFTA negotiations. The problem is that's not how trade deals work. Canada and Mexico have already threatened to walk away from negotiatio…

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/politico
articles.title: Trump considering 25 percent tax on car imports, citing national security - Politico
articles.description: Toronto Star Trump considering 25 percent tax on car imports, citing national security Politico President Donald Trump wants to put a 25 percent tariff on imports of automobiles under a similar authority that allowed him to slap duties on imports of steel and…

articles.author: David Krayden
articles.title: Trump Upbeat On NAFTA Talks
articles.description: ‘I have a feeling we’re going to make a deal on NAFTA.’

articles.author: Canadian Press
articles.title: Justin Trudeau Called Donald Trump To Talk About Steel, Aluminum Tariffs And NAFTA
articles.description: WASHINGTON — Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has spoken by phone with U.S. President Donald Trump about the threat of tariffs. Trudeau called his American counterpart, who is preparing an announcement within days on major steel and aluminum tariffs. Sources say…

articles.author: Bob Bryan
articles.title: Trump wants to slap massive tariffs on imported cars and trucks — here's who would lose the most
articles.description: President Donald Trump is considering slapping tariffs on imported cars and trucks. Some countries would stand to lose a lot from a tariff on vehicles. The biggest losers from a auto tariff would all be US allies: Mexico, Canada, Japan, Germany, and South Kor…

articles.author: Simon Lester
articles.title: How the Trump administration can stop the wild roller coaster of its China trade policy
articles.description: First it threatens a trade war, then it shifts to peace and then back again to threat of tariffs.

articles.author: Mikael Thalen
articles.title: Trump: Tariffs will ‘come off’ if Mexico, Canada sign ‘new & fair’ NAFTA deal
articles.description: “Massive relocation of companies & jobs. Tariffs on Steel and Aluminum will only come off if new & fair NAFTA agreement is signed"

articles.title: U.S. offers Canada-Mexico tariff waiver to ease NAFTA path
articles.description: the Trump administration has offered to exclude Canada and Mexico from tariffs on steel and aluminum as an incentive to reach a deal on a new NAFTA before a string of elections make it difficult.

articles.author: Mallory Shelbourne
articles.title: Trump: Tariffs will ‘come off’ if Mexico, Canada sign ‘new & fair’ NAFTA deal
articles.description: President Trump said Monday that he will only remove the tariffs he announced last week on steel and aluminum imports if the U.S. negotiates "a new & fair" North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA).

articles.title: Canada, Mexico Stick to Nafta Plan After Trump’s Tariff Reprieve
articles.description: While President Donald Trump’s tariff gambit spared his Nafta partners for now, Canada and Mexico are pledging it won’t make them budge at the bargaining table.

articles.author: Mike Ciandella
articles.title: Trump extends steel, aluminum tariff exemptions for Canada, Mexico, EU
articles.description:
President Donald Trump has granted Canada, Mexico, and the European Union a 30-day extension to existing exemptions on steel and aluminum tariffs.

In addition, the U.S. has granted Australia, Argentina, and Brazil permanent exemptions from the tariffs. Sou…

articles.title: Trump Says He’ll Only Cancel His Trade Tariffs If the U.S. Gets a New NAFTA Deal
articles.description: His proposed steel and aluminum tariffs may hit a roadblock at the NAFTA talks

articles.author: Zeke Miller and Kevin Freking, Associated Press
articles.title: Trump links tariff relief for Canada, Mexico if ‘new and fair’ NAFTA deal is signed
articles.description: President Donald Trump said Monday that North American neighbors Canada and Mexico will get no relief from his new tariffs on steel and aluminum imports unless a "new and fair" free trade agreement is signed.

articles.author: Josh Wingrove, Stephanie Flanders
articles.title: Canada Would Rather Have No Nafta Than a Bad Deal, Trudeau Says
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has a message for Donald Trump on Nafta: Canada would rather see a trade deal die altogether than accept certain hardline demands.

articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.title: Donald Trump: ‘We’re Not Backing Down’ on Tariffs
articles.description: Trump put the proposed tariffs of ten percent on aluminum and 25 percent on steel in the context of NAFTA, working with Mexico and Canada to renegotiate the free trade deal.
